description:
CASH ONLY

A wonderful taqueria in the heart of the Mission. It's cash only and from my experience these are the places in San Francisco that know they are not losing business by being so. 

They're recently remodeled! There's now bright yellow walls and colorful traditional flags lining the ceiling. There's a couple communal tables that would comfortably seat six, a couple booths, and some two-seaters. A clean, and fun face-lift T. Cancun!!! 

I'm ALWAYS blown away at how scrumptious the food is. This past time I got a chicken taco, which was juicy and delicious. But previously I've gotten the shrimp burrito special, and a classic carne asada burrito. All of which made me forget about how frustrating it was to scramble cash bills. This is a Mission staple and I will one hundred percent be returning.
author: Navila H.

description:
Came here around 11 because my friends wanted nachos. They gave us free chips with salsa with our order, that was pretty good. The green salsa was pretty spicy. 

We ordered the nachos with no meat and they just looked sort of sad. The nachos consisted of beans and cheese, nothing else. The chips weren't that crunchy and the cheese just stuck to the chips making it even less crunchy. But it was alright given it was so late and I just wanted to eat something. 

Cash only!!!
author: Donald C.

description:
I ordered a vegetarian wet "mojado" burrito to go around 11pm on a Friday night. 

It's topped with hella red enchilada sauce. I appreciate a lot of the sauce, but sadly, the enchilada sauce just tasted like the cheap stuff from the can just dumped on top, I could even kinda taste the metallic flavor from the can. :( 

But otherwise the stuff inside the burrito was pretty yummy, not bad for a late night after drinking meal. But I was quite sober when I ordered FYI. :D

It's so fat and massive, check the pics.
author: Shruti D.

description: I had two super tacos there. Chorizo and al pastor. Both were really good. The chips were just OK but the sauces were fantastic... Both the green and the red which were very spicy. And the food was served very quickly.
author: Gary L.

description: Word on the street is the super burrito is the thing to try in SF and Mission is where to be.  We found this place on a list of places to eat.  It was a Monday night.  We easily ordered and received our food.  It's pretty authentic here, not offering ground beef tacos.  I had a super chicken burrito. My Cousin had the carnitas and my daughter had a cheese quesadilla.  Not going to lie... Anna's Taqueria in Boston has this place beat for flavor but this burrito is a little bigger.  It needed more flavor but kudos on the real deal cheese here.  My daughters quesadilla had so much cheese if she had eaten it she would have been backed up for days!  A little much.  It was ok but did not knock my socks off.  Also... the tortilla's didn't taste like they were made on site or fresh.  (Plus a $9 burrito?)
author: Holly W.

description:
Disclaimer: I am rating this place almost entirely on their veggie burrito, salsas and service. 

My girlfriend and I came here after El Rio during Pride but before our next party stop, knowing we should probably fuel up a bit. There was a bit of a line, but it went by relatively quickly. The cashier was a young guy who seemed indifferent about the line but moved fast enough for me. We had:

-- Vegetarian Burrito (minus cheese and sour cream) // Ok I know this may sound basic since this was essentially just beans, rice, pico de gallo and avocado wrapped in a tortilla but thaT'S WHY IT WAS SO GOOD. (Another disclaimer: I was also low-key buzzed and starving at the time of this meal), but regardless! Everything inside was perfectly executed and the salsas provided alongside the basket of chips were clearly homemade, beautifully balanced, spicy and a great addition to the burrito. I don't think y'all fully understand the value and difficulty level of making homemade salsa that white and Latinx people alike will enjoy. But I digress. 

Servers were busy since there were quite a few people hungry for burritos and tacos. Still, they handled it all gracefully and refilled our salsas with no complaints when we asked, regardless of having multiple orders in hand at the time. 

I might just make this my new go-to late night spot regardless of it being a bit out of the way on my way home - the atmosphere is just what you would expect from a taqueria and in that sense, it feels like home to me.
author: Alex K.

description:
I've been coming here for 10 years and there is nothing better than an al pastor (marinated pork) super burrito. 

The meat is super good and the game changer is they toast the tortilla. This allows the burrito to not get soggy if you wrap it up to finish later. 

Open till late, too!
author: Drew F.

description:
10/10 would recommend! The super nachos with carnitas were filling and cheap! I even took the extra home. Would come back again. It was great to have some great Mexican in San Francisco! 

My friend had the super burrito with chorizo which she said is also delicious! They also do a vegetarian burrito if that's your thing!
author: Jess N.

description: Definitely this restaurant was misstated and is not a four or five star which made us go there. The food was low quality with the price they charged me "cash only". Me and my friend got stomach ache 2 hours after we ate their food.
author: Barry K.

description: I dunno, I think if you advertise yourself out front as "BEST VEGGIE BURRITO IN SAN FRANCISCO," you gotta show up with something besides onions, beans, avocado, rice, cheese, and a mild salsa. It was totally adequate, I'd go there again in a heartbeat if I were a little tipsy, but it's nothing special. The folks who work there are very nice and it makes for a good experience. Salsa verde is superior, but it's nothing incredible.
author: Jacob H.

description:
Came here on a nachos quest because a friend who used to live nearby swore the nachos were the best here. We ordered the super nachos (sans sour cream) with carne asada. Definitely feeds 4 people with normal appetites or 2 very hungry folks. 

The carne asada was browned deliciously. And the avocado was sliced and placed on top. However, we couldn't come to an agreement on the salsa (I liked it, my friend didn't). But the whole thing was let down by the quality of the chips which tasted bland. If they got nice thick salty chips then it would be a 4 star for sure.
author: Jean K.

description:
It's ok, not bad... not great... good size, good price, quick service, average taste

ps... I grew up in the south-bay where we take our burritos seriously so I'm a big of a burrito snob.
author: Honeya O.

description: This is for the al pastor super taco. This taco was so balanced and so delicious. The perfect mix and match of spice and cheese. Fresh avocados, creamy cheese, soft and delicious tortillas, and al pastor that packs a punch. My friend in the area says that the al pastor is her go to and unfailing choice. Pretty incredible incredible for the price. Something about the texture that's unforgettable in my book.
author: AnnaRose G.

description: As far as Mexican food goes, this place is above average. They have a clean restaurant, friendly staff, and surprisingly great salsa. The burrito was on par but I would say it was exceptional compared to its competitors. They were very prompt in cleaning up when customers left and the staff behind the counter appeared professional and hardworking. This is a great lunch stop but the burritos were about 4-stars
author: Nicholas L.

description:
Vegetarians: go here for a veggie burrito. Vegans: they'll add more Avocado at no extra charge to substitute the subtraction of cheese and sour cream. 
They're nice dudes who run the spot who never serve anything but fresh ingredients and best of all, this location is open until 3am on Friday and Saturdays and rarely will you see d-bags of the sort that frequent the original location on 18th and mission.
author: Kristina B.

description: This place is horrible. I can't understand how they stand in business. Reluctantly stopped in again this week for a burrito and quesadilla. Extra greasy; tough, rubbery chicken; not a fan of the chips either--too hard and grainy. I want to like this place, especially because it's open late, but the food is just terrible. So much better food available elsewhere.
author: J. C.

description:
You will be happy here. Excellent veggie, prawn, and steak burritos.

I prefer the other location on Mission & 19th St, which has best burritos in town. But that location is closed for remodeling so this is the second best place in town. I don't know why it tastes slightly different here but it does. It could just be that at the other location, they make the outside burrito shell a little bit crispier on the grill, I'm not sure. 
But you still won't go wrong with either place.
author: John J.

description:
Come with your Spanish polished:) You'll get a small order of chips and salsa if you eat in. They have water to serve yourself which seems to be the neighborhood trend. Remember cash only, but ATM on site. 

She ordered a burrito and I had two different tacos. Tortillas and meat were very fresh. Not too heavy and the flavors were classic. Great option for plain old good Mexican food. 

Staff was also very friendly!
author: Amy R.

description: Used to eat here in the 1990s.  Dreamed of it every since and each time I come back from the east coast, Taqueria Cancun is a must. It never disappointments.  Carne Asada super burrito is THE order here.  Like Angels tap dancing on my tongue.
author: Greg C.

description: Hands down the carne asada super tacos in the Bay Area. Service is fast. Location is ok and perfect for a late night snack after drinks!
author: Michelle C.

description: Yummy carne asada burritos at reasonable prices. They should offer mild salsa though, even though I know they don't have that in Mexico, but either do they have burritos. They could at least make some accommodations for people who don't like spicy food. Even their mildest salsa is quite spicy and I like eating the tomatoes with the salsa. I guess cause they add the jalapeno seeds in it. I do like that they offer free chips with your purchase. They also have great horchata.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Superrrrr basic Mexican food. Went there to try out the hype and it definitely did not live up to the hype. Typical wet burrito, nothing to fancy or special ot set itself apart from anything else BUT it wasn't a bad burrito, just a very basic one. There are defineitly other burrito spots in the city where you can get a much better burrito for your money.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Came here with some local friends after an evening at a brewery a few blocks down. Hands down best (authentic) tacos ever. Most definitely a hole in the wall place, but aren't those always the best? 

Come here after a night out. Order anything on the menu. It's all good. Will definitely be back when I'm in the Bay!
author: Katherine C.

description:
This is hands down, my favorite taqueria in the mission....I live around the corner from El Farolito + La Taqueria...so that says a lot. 

-fast service
-the guys are always super nice and give you extra salsa if you ask
-best horchata
-their nachos (veggie or with meat I've had both) are fire
-super burritos (veggie or with meat I've had both) are bomb and filling
-tacos are amazing

Pretty much just great all around. 
It's my go-to every time I crave a good burrito!
author: Mandy F.

description:
Taqueria Cancun has the best burritos in San Francisco, and by extension, the world. They also have the carnitas that are so delicious they tempted my boo out of 9 years of vegetarianism, and he's never looked back.

Heads up: cash only. There is an ATM inside if you are without.
author: Tasha D.

description: Bla. The chips are super cheap quality and stale . Made the nachos crappy . No one else was too excited about their food.
author: Valerie P.

description:
There's no place like Cancun.

This hole-in-the-wall spot is perfect after a night on the town at El Rio or Royal Cuckoo. And yes, they easily have the best tacos in the Mission.

Come here for late night snacks and stay for the free chips. They're always super friendly and the quick service makes this spot one for the books.
author: Rachel H.

description: Really enjoyed this restaurant. Portions were large and the food was delicious. It's a little confusing picking up your order because there are no numbers. This place is legit
author: sean m.

description: Love this place, I think that there burritos are the best! Definitely coming back soon.
author: Max S.

description:
The place is a-OK.   Kinda hole in the wallish but come on in.  Order at the counter and then have a seat til the call you up.   Seats about 20-30 but of course you can get take out.  You may even want take out and head to the bar across the street.  

They have burritos, tacos and a variety of plates.  It's not a huge selection but that's ok.   Got the large wet burrito and a beer when I was there on a busy Fri night.   It was ready in no time.  

Flavor is good.  Lots of meat and rice.  Lots of sauce and cheese melted into the plate.  Was able to eat half and took the rest home in a go bag. 

I know a lot of people rave about this place and I have to say that it was good but no more than many other Mexican restaurants in the city.  Not sure that I would go out of my way to get here but if I was walking down the street I just might come in back.
author: Marcus K.

description: Every Mexican place I go to I always get the Carne Assad Super Burrito. I'd have to say this is behind Taqueria San Bruno regarding the taste. Behind La Taqueria regarding the balance of ingredients inside of the burrito. Behind El Farolito regarding size and a slight lower grade in taste. That being said, it's not too far off from these 3 spots. Great taste, Great price, very stuffing. There just wasn't a WOW factor. Chips were okay
author: Jason F.

description: Got sick twice at this place. 2nd time my whole family got sick.   The cashier with the diamond earring does not have any customer matters. If u don't want to get sick do not buy food in here. Good luck!!!
author: Monique M.

description:
Only stopped in to poop but the bathroom was relatively clean. Had soap, paper, and a working hand dryer.

4/5 would recommend.
author: Nude P.

description: Hot damn this is a good burrito. I had a super burrito with carne asada, and it was magnificent. Great balance of flavors without being greasy or heavy. The green salsa goes well with it too.
author: Price H.

description:
Their meat is good
They messer out our order pretty bad though

We ordered three burritos, different meats and some without sour cream or cheese. The orders came back all mixed up. Might be a mistake but 2 of the burritos weren't the right order at all, and it wasn't too busy of an afternoon
author: Jad A.

description: Went for some tacos and a burrito and it was amazing. It tasted like my mothers cooking and that's a major plus this place is honestly so good and really good on pricing. New favorite spot.
author: Maria H.

description:
The low key, underrated Mexican food joint. That's my thing. 

There's no lack of Mexican food on Valencia, I'm aware of that first night I stayed around. But with all these hipster-ish restaurants and all, sometimes you just want a nice taco/burrito to go, go back home and watch some utterly offensive Jim Jefferies stand up comedy, with a bottle of cold beer and some laughters. 

So yeah. Late night and nowhere to go? Cancun is your best friend. Don't mind staying at the restaurant if you don't feel like to. Yeah don't let the interior fools you, the food is killing it.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Probably my favorite mission burrito place. I like this location and the one actually in the mission. Both are dives but the burrito is incredible and lasts for 2 meals. The guy was super cool and I added egg to my veggie burrito. They give you chips too wherever you eat in or take out. Washed it all down with horchata. 

Green salsa is killer! Some of the best so don't miss it!
author: Alison B.

description: One of the best vegetarian burritos I've had. For $8.50 you get a huge burrito plus chips. I liked that they heat the tortilla to the point that it's a little crispy like on a quesadilla. I don't know what it is in the burrito that makes it so special, but you'll look forward to every bite no matter how full  you get. The interior is great as well, with bright yellow walls and dozens of little flags hanging from the ceiling.
author: Ben E.

description:
Can anyone say "crazy cheap burritos"? Damn!

$5 for a burrito so big I had to finish it in two meals, plus chips and salsa. Pretty good deal if I do say so me'self

Ironically, the chips was actually much, much tastier than the burrito itself.

The burrito had a lot of stuffing (meat, rice, beans etc), but ended up being very dry with not a lot of sauce. The chips, on the other hand, was surprisingly good--it wasn't just plain tortilla chips, they had some kind of spice baked into it. The salsa sauce served on the side was also had a real spicy KiCK to it.

The inside was decorated like some kind of festival is going on All Da Time, which is uplifting in a way.

Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee
author: Henry L.

description:
This was once a fine establishment to satisfy a voracious appetite. Their salsa verde was decent, the staff knew customers by name and they preemptively placed your order as you approached the counter near the register; this made life great, if not easier. 

But I'm afraid to admit that the comfort of having a quality veggie quesadilla in this neighborhood has vanished. 

It was evident that this place was in decline several months ago when I was served salsa verde that was gray. The salsa gray was forgivable. 

Nevertheless, the customer service has abruptly disappeared. I ordered and paid for two quesadillas several weeks ago, but was only given one. I had to contest this with the man at the register because the server demanded that I bear the burden of proof to prove the purchase of the second quesadilla. The transaction history proved my case. 

Yesterday's order was a debacle. I ordered two veggie quesadillas to go. When I arrived home, I was eager to subdue my drunken belly. I bit into the quesadilla and immediately spit it out. It had chicken. Yuck! 

I dashed back to the taqueria in a fury and asked that they correct this reckless order. They agreed to do so after I expressed my dissatisfaction. This error is totally inexcusable. 

I'm writing this review at 5 in the morning because this experience has crippled my faith in defending this once great place and I admittedly can't go back to bed. 

What was once a landmark in our neighborhood, is now a blurred taqueria store front not worth the convenience. 

Goodbye, Taqueria Cancún.
author: Tommy G.

description: Looking for cheap Mexican drunk food? The carne asada quesadilla is fantastic and hit the spot late at night after drinks. It's basically a slab of steak with melted cheese, then fried in a tortilla. 10/10 would order again.
author: Jane S.

description:
We were close, it's highly recommended. We tried it and didn't even order food! 
The overwhelming smell of Pinesol, the fluorescent lights and the plastic seating killed our buzz.
author: Maria P.

description: Just had some super chicken tacos  for late lunch. Definitely full. They mean super when they say super. $3.99 per super tack with everything.
author: Maddie N.

description:
I prefer this location over the other.  Still good food, but w/o the intense crowd.  also, this part of mission is safer..

the super taco fills me up just enough before an evening of drinking.  and it's only $3.50
author: Angelica C.

description: Asked for extra salsa twice and when we got to the bar where we were eating we did not receive any. My friend and I were sick the next day. We think it is because the refried beans had lard in them and we are veggies.
author: Lori S.

description:
When I was pregnant, I told my husband the first meal I want to have after my labor is a good steak quesadilla from a taqueria.  My husband delivered.  He picked this place because it's walking distance from St. Luke's hospital.  It did take a while for me to enjoy my first meal but it was good.  It wasn't the best quesadilla, I still like El Farolito's or La Guadajalara but this one was good enough.  My husband liked their burrito too.  Funny thing is since trying this place, we've gone here a few times.  Went here before getting discharged from the hospital and many times we've gone to doctor's appointments.  We do love mexican food.  I think my one qualm is I wish it had more sour cream.  
 I think the great review is the great memories that's tied to it.
author: Claire J.

description: The food here is pretty good. Definitely good for when you're drunk and just want some comfort food. The only thing I don't like that they don't have a salsa bar. You have to ask for more salsa and they give you very little.
author: Julia W.

description:
Fresh tasting ingredients, not bland or salty, sour cream actually looks like sour cream and their guacamole doesn't look like a variation of watered down pesto sauce. Yes, I hate when taquerias serve up a type of the aforementioned guacamole, it needs to be smooth and with a bit of a creamy texture to it. 

Cancun ranks pretty high on my list of favorites.
author: Esther A.

description:
Great late-night burrito. 

It's what you'd expect: kind of dirty, hard cafeteria seats and packed to the gills. Lots of savory meats on the grill. Tacos, burritos with every part of a cow or pig (or chicken) that you'd want. They are generous with the meat. 

Only disappointing part was lack of a salsa bar, only giving you a small side of pico de gallo. 

The al pastor burrito was passed around and (almost) unanimously voted "best burrito we've ever eaten." Our DD (and only sober taste tester) the next morning clarified, "it was just alright."

So, if you come in the cold light of day, it may be a different experience.
author: James W.

description: If I could give negative stars I would. I came here for the first time and the cashier was really rude! I got my "super" burrito with no sour cream expecting me to eat all dry. So I returned it and when I was telling him he looked at the burrito all confused so I opened it up and showed him. Who ever is the manager should really teach them customer service and how to make there own food they have on the menu.
author: Lola B.

description: Best spot to get a burrito after some drinks. The carne asada super burrito is extremely good, top it off with the green sauce and you are good to go. It's a cash only place, they have an ATM there but it's a $3 fee. It's my favorite spot to get a burrito at all hours of the day.
author: Steven C.

description: This place is great. Great prices, delicious food, and its open late. You will never leave hungry or disappointed.
author: Leo V.

description:
The food here is just average and pricey for what you get, I thought. 
Got the burrito mojado de carne asada and it was just OK.  The meat wasn't anything special.   I thought the sour cream or crema on top was too sour.  The burrito is a decent size.

The shrimp cocktail tasted off.  The shrimp tasted gritty. 
Horchata was average and slightly watery for my taste.
author: Heejin L.

description: My go to spot for any thing carne asada....  they dont play around when it comes to the tortas.  One day I will figure out how to make their green sauce.
author: Adrian J.

description: Always amazing. Their al pastor is absolutely fantastic and I love the quality of their tortillas. I love going there and their green salsa is also delicious.  Everyone needs to go here especially late evenings.
author: Sean K.

description: This place is bad I gave it a try I ordered chicken enchiladas and they were the worst enchiladas I had and to top it off their orchata no words never going back there. Last the prices on yelp are different
author: Leo G.

description:
you can't find a place that is cheaper than this 6.50 for super burrito 5.50 for regular and a vegetarian!! 
only thing they speak little English! so little hard to order something that little more then they can understand. 
oh well I'll still come bk! bc it's cheap!!! lol!!!
author: Lizzie G.

description:
The plus?? it didn't give me food poisoning.

Now for the minus. Ordered a bean and rice burrito, it was eh, you'd think for $8 they would give u more than a baby slice of avocado. 

There's no salsa bar, and when you ask for more salsa, they'll tell you "there's some in the bag (yes a teaspoon)" and when you ask for more, you get a crazy attitude look and one more salsa. 

Too much mexican food in the mission to put up with that.
author: Rocky R.

description:
Inedible, I end up going once a year since it's literally right next door to my apartment.
I have no clue where these 5 star reviews come from. Take your money someplace else, you'll even have a better meal from safeway up the block!

Just got a burrito for lunch, didn't finish it (and I finished almost everything I get)
Guy handed it to me in gloves with raw beef blood on it. Inside was nasty tasting as well

The restaurant smells of some industrial cleaning product (though it's not very clean) - so much cleaner that your nose will start to hurt. I wonder if they are covering up for some sort of other nasty smell.

I will not be coming back.
author: John L.

description: Super taco is nice, reasonable price and enough to make you full :) Staffs are nice. They help you go through the menu. You can even ask for extra salsa source.
author: Aim-on S.

description:
I heavily rely on lengthy Mission Street as my 5-star destination for my burrito craving. You can't go wrong with most of the finer taquerias for your craving of the "silver bullet."

But after my recent visit to Taqueria Cancun near Bernal Heights, I may have depended on them way too much. 

I came here for lunch and ordered my usual super burrito. For $6.00, I get the grilled steak with rice, beans, salsa, avocado, sour cream, Mexican cheese, chopped onions and cilantro in a large flour tortilla. All the key interior ingredients were fresh and tasty and the grilled meat was grilled very nicely. But the cook burnt my tortilla while cooking it on the grill. I don't mind the tortilla being a little burnt, but it was overly scorched (see my picture and would you eat that?).

I've been eating here about forty times, but never had any problems here until today. Burning the tortilla is a minor issue, but I'll continue to come back and eat my burrito here and other food.
author: Matt G.

description:
I really like this place. This was my favorite Taqueria in my childhood. They still have great food. All the food taste very fresh!

 I just went recently and was glad I did. The only thing that threw me was that they only take cash. That can be a deal breaker for me since I never carry cash. 

They have very late hours as well. 

I would give them 5 stars if they just accepted debit/credit card.
author: Sarmad N.

description:
Writing a review for Taqueria Cancun is unnecessary. Who doesn't love good tacos? However I do need to express my love for the Carne Asada Nachos. They get their own review. 

I went out with my friend Rosy to play bingo at the Knockout, on our way we picked up some yummy beef nachos, extra jalapenos. The Knockout lets you bring in food, as long as your tidy and those lucky nachos made me win bingo on the first game. The Carne Asada Nachos are pretty big, so you get a lot for your money. 

I couldn't finish the review without mentioning the Grilled Chicken Burritos, which are my favorite and two meals for me. Also the Ceviche tostada deserves an honorable mention.
author: Rebekah T.

description: You guys. They changed the salsa verde and it sucks. The only reason to go there was for a vehicle for that salsa. It's time for revolution.
author: Brooke B.

description: I came here drunk after a night out. My friends and I placed our orders and surprisingly it took for ever to get our orderd because the food runner refused to answer our questions. He pretended he did not understand Spanish, well this guy looked like Cantinflas and his accent was thicker than Sofia Vergara's so I hope next time he knocks the B.S. off and stops acting like a douchebag, otherwise we'll end up at the next-door taqueria.
author: Chloe B.

description:
Carne Asada Burrito = Stomach Ache all next day and bathroom visits in the high single digits.

The very least I expect from a $10 burrito is for it not to jack up my intestines.
author: Jim M.

description:
This place USED to be pretty good. The quality of their food has dropped tremendously over the past couple of years. Pretty obvious they just don't care anymore and it definitely shows, and their prices aren't any cheaper than their competitors. As a quick note the carne asada can/will now have chunks of bone and a healthy serving of un-chewable cartilage nodules.

After getting food poisoning (never had food poisoning before), as well as a close friend at a different date, will opt to never go back unless its for the cheap chips and salsa. A bloody shame too as it's the only simple taqueria in the vicinity :(

Do yourself a big favor and hit up 24th street and have pick of the litter of many that are better.
author: Dayman D.

description:
Humblebrag:  I have eaten what some might consider an alarming number of burritos in my life, from all across the country.

This location of Taqueria Cancun is probably my favorite taqueria.  Way less busy/pretentions/full of partiers and hipsters than the other Mission location.  Their super burritos are a gift from Maude.  Meat grilled perfectly, stuffed with avocado, and if you're super pro you'll ask them to grill the tortilla.  Staff has always been incredibly nice.  In retrospect, I think it may have been a mistake to write this review because now I'm craving one of their toddler-sized burritos.

Cash only!
author: Amber M.

description: This place has messed up my order several times now. Worst part is that the order is very simple yet these guys always mess it up. This morning I just ordered a chorizo and eggs breakfast burrito and ended up with a greasy soggy burrito that only has beans chorizo meat and cheese. The most disgusting burrito I've seen in my life.
author: Ron P.

description:
I'm at St. Luke's Hospital in early labor and all I want right now through these contractions is a super veggie burrito from Can Cun. 

That's what I think of this place.
author: Bonnie G.

description:
OK, so how can two Taqueria Cancuns (...or would it be Taquerias Cancun) be so different? The one I've been to in my distant past is the grimy one that's still there at Sixth and Market. I get cold sweats thinking about how I ate there once and had a derelict yelling at me for not giving him some change. It was not a dining experience I ever wanted to repeat, and I sprint just a little faster every time I pass by it on the way home. 

So it was with trepidation that I suggested to Jamie W. that we go to the one in the Outer Mission after noticing that El Zocalo was closed (yet again!) Wow, what a difference a neighborhood makes...so bright, open and colorful with a conscientious server and lots of seating. The menu is full of bargain-priced food, enough to thrill a truckload of illegal migrant workers... IMMIGRACION!... IMMIGRACION!!

Or even an overweight Asian-American looking for a cheap meal. But is the food better than my memory of their sister operation? Oh yes. I ordered the $4.99 Carnitas Torta, melty goodness in a French roll with plenty of pork, cheese, refried beans, and avocado along with tomato, onion and sour cream (see photo). Because it was cheap (a bad excuse), I also ordered a simple $2.99 Quesadilla that used the same cheesy goodness (see photo). Delicious.

Jamie ordered the hefty $7.99 Super Nachos platter, an extravaganza of corn chips, melted cheese, refried beans, sour cream, guacamole and salsa with chunks of al pastor (marinated pork) and slices of avocado and jalapeno on top (see photo). Like I said, hefty... and awfully good. 

FOOD - 4 stars...really good Mexican on the cheap 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...Surprise!... clean and spacious, especially on a weekday night 
SERVICE - 4 stars...certainly fast enough for my considerable appetite 
TOTAL - 4 stars...OK, the good sister lives in the Outer Mission and her evil twin lives off Sixth...got it?
author: Ed U.

description: Hey, if you've got a big appetite or you know your date does, then you might like how the burrito is stuffed, rolled and covered in sauce here. The competition for best virgin burrito in SF is a tight one. This joint is just about as good as any other. If your date eats the whole enchilada (meaning burrito), your luck will probably run out shortly. Those things are big enough to stuff a mule and keep it going until it gets to the other side of the border.
author: Anna L.

description:
Even though everyone raves about La Taqueria a little further up Mission, I would choose Taqueria Cancun every time. 

When it comes to vegetarian tacos, there is no contest. The beans,the salsas, the perfect proportions. Everything is so flavorful. Meanwhile a lot of other places just seem to dial in veggie orders and focus on the meats. 

I would totally give this place 5 stars if there was anywhere to park. But that's okay, I'll honestly risk the ticket.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
I got the super burrito with carne asada and it tasted great! The chips and salsa are pretty good too. The order comes out pretty quickly so if the line seems long, don't worry, it'll move fast. 

Not a great dine-in spot, definitely more of a late night place. It's a pretty small restaurant, a little dirty, and the place probably seats about 30 people.
author: Jason X.

description:
This is my favorite Mission burrito spot. Way less of a line than some nearby spots and I prefer their burrito over other more highly touted places in the area. 

Seating can be a bit hard to come by.
author: max m.

description: They just raised their prices to a ridiculous amount and I will now boycott them indefinitely. Plenty of other places to go in the mission. The owner decided to get greedy and increase the price for a super and veggie burrito to $9 ($10 after tax). Insane. Absolutely boycotting.
author: David C.

description: Their food is very good and authentic, I definitely recommend Taqueria Cancun. The homemade Melon juice was a refreshing choice too.
author: Randy S.

description: The food is average. I've had much better. I asked the Alex (the guy at the register) if the chips are homemade. He told me they make their own chips. When I asked for hot fresh chips he proceeded to tell me that the chips are made at their other location and are brought to this location. The chips look store bought. They're stacked in baskets and handed to customers who are dining in the restaurant. Basically, the chips are inedible.
author: Not Impressed A.

description:
Inquired about animal products in rice and beans-not vegan :( 
Although I mistakenly ate a burrito- it was delicious. Just saying.
author: Teresa C.

description: Quick service. Delicious burrito overflowing with the ingredients. The tortilla grilled, toasted then I just love that. Not too much cheese, everything tastes so fresh. Complimentary chips and salsa, pico de Gallo and green salsa. I love this place.
author: Tasina H.

description:
Wow!  When you go away from this stuff for a long time it taste crazy good.  I know a lot of people prefer other taquerias in the city...I've been to most of them that haven't been established in the near term (3 or 4 years) but I grew up on taqueria cancun (since the 80's @ the orig in 6th & Market) and I love me some BURRITO MOJADO or ALAMBRE.  No one makes a wet burrito like taqueria cancun.  Get al pastor or legua for meat choices.  If you like something different go for the cabesa or sesos.

Stay away from your boring dry burrito guys.  Make it WET...the pleasure is all there.  Don't knock it till you try it.  C'mon live a little...be adventurous.

Really great service over here this afternoon.  If you speak Spanish, even a little, it goes a long way.
author: Jules S.

description:
Solid spot for Mexican food in the city.

Got the veggie burrito ...'twas so delicious!! My boyfriend got two carne asada super tacos that were easily...hands down the best tacos I've ever tried and seen so far in my life as a Californian.

Definitely will choose this location over the one on market and 6th. It's cleaner, bigger and the tacos are better.

They kindly give you chips with quac AND salsa! Incredible
author: T R.

description: Good late night tacos! Went after a show and it was exactly what I wanted from my first taco in the city! Would go again anytime! I had the super taco with al pastor, avocado, sour cream. Highly recommend!
author: Katherine L.

description:
I loved this place. I am all about culture and this place had it. We looked at four different places before going to this one. The service was fast but the space is really small. There was just enough room to walk past people but it was totally worth it. The food was fantastic. The portions are  more than worth your money. 

One thing I was pleasantly surprised at was the bathroom was so clean. The staff was cleaning while we we're there so they get props for that. That shows me that they want to portray a clean environment. The only downside was in the bathroom, there was no where to hang my bag but it wasn't that big of a deal. 

The only reason it gets a four is because of the lack of space. There is just enough seating and the seating that is there is really close together. (I'm all about personal space.)
author: Monique L.

description: One of my favorite taquerias in SF. The burritos and suizas are unreal. Try their el pastor. Pretty cheap too which is a major +.
author: Lucas H.

description:
To this day I cannot fathom how this place has a following.  But, the great SF burrito debate drags on.
This place is best for broke people with no textural sense, but looking for nutritional sustenance.
First; why lettuce on a burrito?  It just wilts and turns to mush.
Second; why rice on a burrito?  But this is a fundamental requirement for many burrito fans; so we just have to agree to disagree.   For me, rice is just extra carb filler.  It adds nothing to burritos other than size.
Salsa here is lame.
author: Josh K.

description:
Make that 200 reviews for Taqueria Cancun.

Okay, I'll say it again:  Lots of places serve "good Mexican food".  Here, you can certainly get it.  I'm always on the lookout for a place that has a great $5 burrito, and yes, they have it here.

This is one of those "if you're in the neighborhood" places.  Yes, if you are, this is a place you will want to visit for solidly good Mexifood at a good price.
author: Matthew D.

description: Great burritos... I must have had a thousand of these in the 15 years I've lived nearby. Mostly veggie burritos, as meat is the weak spot at this place. But the boiled shredded chicken is quite good! Carne asada, not so much... I prefer that at farrolito. BUT nonetheless, this is the restaurant I go to more than any other, and that says a lot. The salsa verde with blended avocado and tomatillo is epic!
author: Fletcher S.

description:
Hit and miss. So far, I've been here twice and ordered the chorizo super quesadilla both times. My first time here was amazing... Five stars, I was in awe. The quesadilla was so big and delicious! The second time, it took them nearly 20 minutes, and my quesadilla was barely warm. I highly recommend getting a super quesadilla (and probably saving half of it) since the normal quesadilla barely has anything but cheese.

The service is fine, willing to help you but not the friendliest. There are a bunch of tables you can sit at, but they could be cleaner... Price is great, and they give you some chips and salsa too! I'm not used to getting anything free at a less-than-$10 place!
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
Taqueria Cancun is a small taco shop on Mission Street that is open late and services beer until 11 pm.  It's a great late night place with good burritos and even better tacos.  Every order comes with free chips and salsa (red and green salsa) which is a great bonus for your order.  The food is made quickly and they supply unlimited water as well.  I've only come here late at night and the night-time weekend rush is not too bad because they're service is very efficient.  They burritos are made fresh with rice, beans, lettuce, salsa, and your choice of meat as well as guacamole and sour cream if you ask for it.  However,  I prefer the tacos (2 per order) over burritos because they are amazing and made to perfection and they do not fall apart while you eat it.


I would recommend it to anyone is out and about in the mission on a Friday or Saturday as it's a great late-night eatery!
author: Robert T.

description: I saw the guy who was preparing by burrito spit in my food. The burrito was soggy after. I think it because I'm white. I think this is another one of those racist Mexican restaurants in SF. I hadn't done anything wrong. If these people don't like their jobs, then I think they should quit. I am proud of who I am and I will not be ashamed because I'm white.
author: Rich A.

description: By far and away the best burrito I've had in the Mission.  That is all.
author: Tarah D.

description:
Consistently a two-star place. 
I mean, its great for drunk food.
who needs Avocado AND Guaq on their nachos? 
Their horchata and juice is really yummy if you need a sugar rush.


but honestly, Los Panchos is right across the street and its better.
author: Jenny C.

description: FYI - The vegetarian burrito is not as the rice isn't vegetarian or vegan (cooked with chicken stock).
author: Kris R.

description: Most recently of Nate Silver fame, Taqueria Cancun definitely has a reputation, which may be more hype than anything else. It's definitely not bad, but I've had the famous al pastor a couple of times, and the most memorable part was how wet and messy it was. Try it late at night, when convenience and sloppy quantity is more important than the cheapest, best burrito, and you'll be more than satisfied.
author: Cailin H.

description: I frequent the mission and love enjoying some good Mexican food after a few beers! This time I was completely sober and was able to actually enjoy my food. Out off all the Mexican food I've ever had this is by far the best yet! I ordered two al pastor super tacos and i can't even describe how amazing they were. I for sure will be back and would recommend this place to everyone 5 stars deserved hands down and the best part was even the service was amazing  the cashier guy was amazing as well
author: David J.

description:
2nd stop on my burrito tour of SF!

A++. Complimentary chips & I am SOLD!
Jk, I'm not so easy, BUT the burritos here are definitely winning. The staff is unbelievably friendly and nice and the crowd is an assortment of young trendy groups and straight up hungry people.

Super burrito, duh. They do a good job of toasting the tortilla so it's all quesadilla-like.
author: Lian T.

description:
Hands down best veggie tacos on earth! Gotta get them with black beans... and extra green salsa! Cheap, quick, convenient.

Tip: Use your complimentary chips to scoop up half of the ginormous taco, then  you can eat the rest like a regular taco.
author: Ganesha B.

description:
My Bodyguard Ed Lover Muay Thai Street Fighter and I were out Bar hopping in the Mission the Other Night and I Spotted Taqueria Can -Cun which peaked my interest but we were a little thirsty . So we popped into a Bar for a drink . Ed and I were engaged in great conversation with a couple of lovely ladies. I suddenly felt an urge for a Burrito , Ed Lover was deep in Conversation with the Ladies . So me being the Polite and Discreet guy that I am ,not wanting to disrupt his flow. . Popped outside to the front of the bar and left a Voice mail letting him know where i was at . I wandered in to Taqueria Cancun LOL. Its a hole in the wall but it was packed with Mission Street Hipsters and a few Thug life type folks. So I got in line and Ordered an Al Pastor Super Burrito and was given Chips Salsa and Guacamole as an appetizer . My Burrito was ready in 5 minutes and it was a BIG. 
I started in and it was the Yummiest Burrito Ive had in a while. I was half way through my Burrito and received a call from my Bodyguard Ed worried about me wandering around in such a rough neighborhood alone LOL. I let him know where I was and he entered TC like the Pinoy Tupac that he is and let his presence be known WEST SIDE!!! 
I will have to return again and try more items out.
author: Eugene L.

description: MUCH MUCH gratitude to Alex, Ernesto and the staff at Cancun in Bernal. I made a dumb, drunk maneuver, and left my shoulder bag there after a late night taco. The staff found the bag, which contained my brand new laptop and an external hard drive with years of valuable files and photos. I was crushed when I realized it was gone. I went back the next day to ask if they had found it, alas the day crew had no knowledge of it. Upon returning today, almost a week later, the night crew were there and surprised me with it. He had actually gone out of his way to look me up on Facebook and send me a message. Little did I know it was sitting in my "other" mail folder. I am super humbled and grateful that they held onto it and did their best to return my valuable stuff. Super awesome, guys...!!
author: joey e.

description:
Ordered a burrito here about a few weeks ago. It was disappointing. I took it home and regret every bite. I ordered a lengua burrito but it turned out to be more like a veg-burrito, with a few small pieces of meat. 85% of it was beans and rice. 

Skip it there are better places down the way. Oh, this is a review only for this location. I like and have no complaints of their other two locations (SOMA and the one near 17th and Mission).
author: M R.

description: good Mexican restaurant. had a super veggie burrito and it was good. has a fun, festive atmosphere. feels like a beach spot.
author: Denise C.

description: This is the pick of many local for the best burrito in the Mission and for god reason. The service is fast and friendly with a spacious and clean dining area. They wrap the burritos full here and you'll easily have enough for two meals.
author: Darren F.

description: These guys dont give a crap. They have gotten my order wrong many times. Go to gran taco loco on 29th and mission
author: Daniel Z.

description:
Carnitas burrito and a horchata the size of my face. My deathbed request for a final meal. 

I moved to CT and I miss Cancun every day.
author: Shana H.

description: Looking for a no-frills, Classic Burrito experience in the Mission?  Well this is the place...selection of fillings include grilled and shredded versions of chicken and steak; tasty marinated carnitas; chips and a flavorful salsa verde round out the meal - and they offer Mexican coke to wash everything down with.
author: Rich R.

description: One of a few very good choices of taquerias within a 10 block stretch of Mission. This is the one out near Valencia( Burger King across the street)  at the foot of Bernal- They have a few simple items and do things  their way , which just happens to be quite a good way  they actually cook the sandwiches and burritos on a flat  griddle top, that's what give them a nice crispy exterior. Pastor ( pork) and carne asada burritos are real winners in the meat category and the veggie super ( $ 8.75) is hard to put down in one sitting. The place does a steady business at lunches and evenings. Good beer selection, aguas frescas, veggie juices & homemade tortilla chips, note : they are a little skimpy with the salsa, do not have kid portions and it's cash on the barrelhead only, son. For the really hungry try their Burrito Mojado (A Big One) meat, rice, beans, onions, cilantro, salsa, topped with enchilada sauce, green salsa, melted cheese, sour cream & mexican salsa -colorfully festive in decoration it's still a bit divey, Not a place you'd want to linger too long, but good for a tasty, cheap and filling meal.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Holy Mother of Burritos! Taqueria Cancun, you are gooooooood!!!!

SF's 7x7 list has been on a roll lately. From the bacon wrapped oysters @Anchor & Hope (delish) to the Porcetta Sandwich @Roli Roti (a big WOW for taste), & now a super burrito @Taqueria Cancun. Thank you, 7x7, for introducing me to this spot. 

What's even more amazing is that it ONLY cost $5.99. Awesome deal!!!

Although a cheap-o burrito, you'd think taste would be comprised. Nope, not the case here. We ordered a super steak burrito, no rice, and black beans. The tortilla was slightly grilled & had a nice, little crunch to it even. The burrito had savory chunks of plentiful carne asada w/ just the right amount of cheese. I loved the fresh slices of avocado, too. Half a burrrito later....I was satisfied. And now, I have lunch for tomorrow.

Overall: Thankful to have found this cool taqueria. Service was good (friendly cashier) & it's a clean, no frills, casual spot to grab a quick bite to eat! Big thumbs up to their super burritos!

Tips:
*Bring quarters for the parking meters.
*Bring cash. Credit cards are not accepted.
*Chips & (spicy) salsa are complimentary. Woohoo!
author: Joy A.

description: They charge for meat on super nachos now here. It's 3 dollars more. So super nachos is 7 bucks with no meat. This place sucks now and the nachos aren't as good as they used to be. Never coming back. Epic fail cancun. Super lame nachos. 10 for nachos.
author: Bert D.

description: Every week I end up saying "2 veggie burritos, both with black beans and one with no sour cream." And I never regret it.
author: Ge O.

description:
My favorite burrito place in SF. Flaky tortillas, fresh grilled meats, great avocado, nice service. And never crowded, at least at lunch, mellow and convenient.

Two years later, still my favorite place.
author: Nelson M.

description:
While it's not my favorite taqueria in the city, Taqueria Cancun doesn't fall short in making good burritos. That's just it though...they're good, not great. 

I've had a couple other dishes, like tacos and super quesadillas but my go-to order is always a burrito. A vegetarian burrito runs about $6 here and gets you a HUGE burrito filled with rice, pinto beans, cheese, tomato, onion, cilantro and avocado. I can never finish the whole thing in one sitting, so their burritos are perfect for leftovers since they're so big! 

Also, their chips aren't my favorite and I feel like they're kinda stale. They give you two different kinds of salsa - pico de gallo and salsa verde. Salsa verde is pretty spicy but definitely my favorite out of the two.

With so many other taquerias in the Mission, Taqueria Cancun isn't my go-to place for a burrito but it's still a good choice if you're in Bernal Heights.

*Cash ONLY!*
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This is a bit awkward to reveal, but the thing is, I'm a burrito skeptic. (I know, I know, like being an agnostic in the Bible Belt.) It's just...why do I need soooo much relatively flavorless rice and tortilla and cheese and sour cream? Why not skip the fillers, stick to the good parts, and just order tacos?

Then I moved a few blocks away from Taqueria Cancun, and finally understood the purpose of the burrito. What made the difference? Largely the big chunks of fresh avocado where most places use guacamole, but the fresh-griddled tortilla and restrained hand with the sour cream and cheese don't hurt either. 

I personally think the beef and the chorizo are the best meat choices, but the al pastor was the only option I've tried that genuinely disappointed.
author: Amy L.

description: I have never been of the belief that this is the best Taqueria in San Francisco ever , I guess I should disclose that . With that stated , I should say though it's always been good to fair , and that by far this is the best of the locations . I was very hungry last night after bar'ing across the street and had a yen for a Quesadilla . I went with the super which gives you all the fixings including avocado , and well... it just wasn't that good. Like not even being slightly buzzed could I be convincing myself this was a tasty treat . It was greasy and the carne asada was tasteless . I think it gave me a tummy ache to be honest. Still good chips and salsa though for sure, very nice and quick staff, and haven't inflated the prices so that's definitely positive.
author: Lauren V.

description: Omg these burritos are insane. We just went and there was no line, food came out fast but was cooked perfectly. We got carne asada and pastor burritos (not both meats, one each).  Very tasty and not too super big, so you don't feel like you ate a small child. Chips leave a little more to be desired and they barely give you a handful, but burritos are so good, you don't need it.definitely recommend this place
author: Traci H.

description: Not bad, not remarkably good. I live a few doors down so that's my main reason for frequenting. They have carrot and orange juice. The service is very stiff. The food is not notable.
author: Addie S.

description: MAN would you guys please stop using those nasty Costco chips.They are too salty and gross. I feel like I'm at a bad house party ever time I eat those chips. Most taquerias in the city fry their own, or buy them fried from other local businesses. I got really excited when you had new authentic chips the other day. Finally, I thought, they got the memo. But no. Sadly, today the same old tired, dry, mealy chips were back. What a bummer. I definitely wouldn't have ordered nachos on these cardboard shingles.
author: Phillip F.

description:
Al Pastor was its name. And eating was the game. 

Ordered my al pastor in super burrito style. I was hungry, yo. Burrito was great. Tortilla was nicely grilled adding that slight crunch to the bite! Meat was juicy, warm, tender, flavorful. Towards finishing it up, I noticed no sign of runny grease at the bottom of my foil. Didn't make the burrito dry though. Just felt that something was missing.

3.5 stars. As much as I try to find a burrito that comes close to what I've had in SoCal, or Mexican food much less, this place falls a little short. Don't get me wrong though. Awesome food. I'm just real picky about this kind. But try it out and see for yourself.
author: Will S.

description:
This is the one place I opt for a veggie burrito over a taco. Why? Science. The lightly toasted tortilla on the burrito equals amazing. 

I don't love the chips or the salsa, but I can look past this because the burrito really is that good.
author: Amber K.

description:
After going here so many times and putting up with it I have decided to just say this:

Gristle. Abundance of those pieces that no one wants to chew in their carne asada burrito no matter how drunk you are. Every single time, in every burrito.

The "out of the bag chip thing" I can overlook if the food was better. But in this case I can't even do that.
author: j m.

description:
You know that moment when you're watching Man vs. Wild and the advisory pops up telling you about how all those amazing stunts Bear Grylls does are merely staged demonstrations and not actual survival tactics based on life-threatening situations? 

I close my eyes too during this advisory because I'd rather watch the show pretending everything's happening because the lion is actually chasing him or it's so cold that he physically needs to gut a camel, drag its entrails and sleep in within its boney carcass.  

The point I'm trying to arrive at is I don't care where the meat comes from in Taqueria Cancun's burritos. I'd rather close my eyes and skip the metaphorical advisory and devour their bomb burrito in Bear Grylls bliss.
author: Monica S.

description: This place is pretty standard in terms of Mexican eateries. Whether you order in or take out, your meal comes with complimentary chips and red/green salsa, which are freshly made. When I was here, I ordered my favorite: carne asada torta. The torta did its job in filling me up, but it wasn't anything spectacular in my opinion. The bread wasn't toasted enough, so it was still soft instead of the usual crunch. It was also lacking in terms of guacamole spread and salsa in my torta. The meat itself wasn't as juicy and tender as I had hoped, but was sufficient. I will come back if this was the only joint open at the time, but otherwise, I will venture out to other eateries in the area first to try different tortas. Tip: they only accept cash, so leave your cards at home!
author: Hurnan V.

description:
Cancun vs. Cancun.

One features tackiness and drunk college students. Yes I went. And yes I'm judging years later.

Other features delicious and massive burritos for a college drink special price ($5) as well as service faster than it takes a frat boy to drink his beer.

Chicken burrito debauchery will be remembered far longer than my spring break debauchery. Not spending time in this Cancun drunk certainly helps.
author: Jason B.

description: My favorite taqueria in SF hands down. Very kind service and amazingly good food. The tortilla they use is phenomenal.
author: Zach M.

description:
I have been to all 3 San Francisco Taqueria Cancun locations and this one if by far my favorite. Though I have received good service in all locations, I feel this one is the best as far as food,space, atmosphere and clientele. The staff here are very friendly and always seem like they are having a good time. 

Mellow in the afternoon and early evenings, wild and crazy in the late evenings when the party moves to everyone's favorite taqueria just down the street from El Rio!

Now to talk about the food. Their vegi burritos are to die for, but my all time favorite has to be their Super Carnitas Taco's with "everything". Not even sure what that all includes but it is simply magic in your mouth. Highly recommend to one and all meat eaters out there. 

Also the horchata is good as well. If you are not familiar with this delicious beverage see the link I have included http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horchata#Latin_America

It's a drink made fresh every day and very authentic. Perfect with any Taqueria Cancun meal!
author: Goth Kitty Jen J.

description:
I used to frequent this place when I lived in SoMa (Sleazy 6th, to be exact). The service there was actually great, despite their having to put up with all manner of craziness on the block.

The food is not bad here in the Mission/Bernal location, but the guy who is often at the cash register seems to hate taking orders and having to do basic arithmetic. I'd rather go somewhere else in the neighborhood, where I know I can end up with 1) the kind of burrito I ordered and 2) not a pocket full of odd change.
author: Joel S.

description: Feels like a taco place...plastic plates and giant cups of horchata.  The food is very good.  The complimentary chips are not homemade but the salsa is excellent.  The super taco wasn't my favorite, but the carne asada is delicious.  My favorite was the enchilada.  The serving size was good and it comes with rice and beans.  I loved the enchilada sauce.  My kids loved the plain quesadillas.
author: Ryan K.

description: Simply the best burrito in San Francisco...hands down.
author: Rael E.

description: Let me just say that i have gone here in the past and they were pretty good BEFORE my 2 recent visits. One of my recent visits i ordered my daughter a regular burrito with cilantro and onions and no hot sause, what do they give me a big tortilla with just meat, cilantro and onions!!!! WHAT???? My daughter was very disappointed. I let it go maybe it was a mistake, YEAH RIGHT! On another occasion my boyfriend  tries to order me a qusadilla suiza and they tell him they don't make those their!!!!! ITS ON THE MENU! when he gets to my job with what ever he could order, and he is eating his regular beef burrito he finds out that their is only rice and salsa in it THATS IT!!!!  Words could not express how upset he was.
author: Ana M.

description: After 20+ years in SF, this remains my fave taqueria, especially for the veggie burritos!
author: Georgette R.

description:
Cancun has the best burritos I have ever had. Ever. 

I usually get the chorizo super burrito and every time, I die of happiness and go to burrito heaven. It is so good!! And also very cheap as far as good food goes in sf. 

As a California native with an obsession for burritos, I've tried quite a few. This is place is the best. Make your way to Cancun in the mission. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jill E.

description: Meh, I've had better. The super burritos are kind of small. The super nachos not that super, the chip and others ratio isn't that even and the spice is overpowering (and I can handle my spices). The super nachos are meh as well. I ordered a lot, but had some of each.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Veggie burrito was delicious, but I am suspect about the rice as well, my body wasn't happy and I'm pretty sure there was chicken stock in it. If that's a problem for you, stay away.

Service, blinding fast. Horchata available. Very genuine little taqueria.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Great drunk food, I know this because I've stumbled in here all lit up and gotten my grub on before.

Standard taqueria fare and tasty salsas.

The reason for the four stars though is because this place knows how to bring the heat.  I've ordered lots of super burritos from many different taquerias and taco trucks and I always request them extra spicy.  Seldom do I consider the burritos I get actually spicy, but the "extra spicy" carne asada super burrito I ordered here actually was deliciously hot.
author: Brad R.

description:
Burrito, yay! Getting back to the bar and realizing it had a tiny bit of meat,  tons of rice and nothing else. It was not super by any stretch. It was awful.

WTF has happened to this place?
author: Mike F.

description: Very good authentic Mexican! Every order comes with chips and yummy guac and salsa. The burrito was different than most and very good. Bathroom wasn't the cleanest, that would be my only complaint.
author: Dara R.

description:
I would've given the 5th star had they remembered to hold the guac 4 times alread!!!
I am starting to think its a joke they play on me...other than that this is the next best thing to Gordo's (east bay).
What ever they use in their Chili Verde is mixed with crack because I cant get enough...I woke up many times at 12:45am praying they are still open or some of those hipster kids are forming a stay open line just to score some green sauce. Best value in my opinion are the super tacos.
I also love that they bring your "aqui" order to your table in less than no time.
author: Wild Style G.

description: Everyone hears about how unbeatable San Fran burritos are... So upon my first time being in SF, the first stop was here. The family that we're renting a home from a few streets up had suggested it and man were they spot on. Burritos tasted fresh, authentic, and were packed to the brim! My one bummer moment was seeing that they don't include cheese, lettuce or guac inside. So I wouldn't really call that a "Super Burrito." But all in all, that thing was gone in nothing flat! I'd say worth your time if you find yourself hungry on mission st.
author: Taylor S.

description: Legit Mexican food! Had the carne asada burrito.... Delicious!!!! Happy we stopped in!
author: Karin L.

description:
The first time I came here was years ago and I had ordered a pork taco salad served in a fried tortilla shell. Oh my goodness it was delicious, I'm talking tunnel-vision delicious. 

Now years later I live in the area and you know what? It really is the best veggie burrito I've had in the city, and for just $5 that's a great deal. It's an inexpensive spot to stop by before you head to El Rio or the Knockout for some drinks with friends.
author: Rachel W.

description:
4 people
4 burritos
every single burrito was wrong
i ordered beef ... got chicken
cousin ordered no cheese.... got cheese
other cousin ordered no onions.... got onions
other cousin ordered refried beans... got pinto beans
not one burrito was correct
and it wasnt even busy
and it was FREEZING in there.
author: beth m.

description:
Has still got it.

Tip: this is the one with the lovely, almost sweet, salsa verde. 

No charges for chips. Loads of salsa. Fast. Dirty. Cheap. Good. 

(not quite so dirty as, say, 19th/mission or 6th/market. Family-friendly Cancun). Fabulous veggie burritos.
author: Glen M.

description: This is amazing mexican food. It is great for vegetarians and meat eaters. I had the eggs a la Mexicana and my fiancé had the eggs con chorizo. Both delicious. Their horchata is also tasty. The only issue is they are cash only.
author: Arielle M.

description:
These burritos are awesome!  I get the burrito mojado with carnitas every time.  It's realllly good!  I am a sauce fiend and they give you TONS of it.  I recommend getting it to go, because you get more sauce that way.

The burrito is HUGE, and it's cheap.  What more can you ask for?
author: Shae H.

description:
A great place for a last call burrito! Not sure I'd go here during the day time, but post-Makeout Room it does the deed. 

Watched a guy pick a burrito off the floor piece by piece...

Five minutes later I noticed his burrito had disappeared...

*shudder*

Yes. Great for 2 AM.
author: Leigh W.

description:
You want the real thing go to LA TAQUERIA on Mission.  

The last three times I went to Taqueria Cancun in the last two years:

They put a tiny pinch of meat in by burrito.  I'm talking like, 1/4 cup of meat-No exaggeration.  

This last time I went, business was quiet.  They forgot about my order and I waited fifteen minutes before going up and saying "hey I ordered something".  Their response "huh, oh...sorry".

I'm done with this place.  I've lived in this hood for 12 years and I know a good burrito-This ain't it.
author: Dante S.

description:
This Cancun location gets five stars for me- it's a little bigger, a little brighter and a lot cleaner than it's other locations.  It's also closer to my casa, which is nice for me (but what do you care?).

Anyway, the super prawn burrito is to die for.  They really load that baby up with prawns- it's chock full of the perfectly grilled, crunchy, plump crustaceans.  I love to cut the burrito in half so my first bite is gooey, creamy, hot, amazing.

Their carnitas super tacos are also amazing and a great deal.  A little over 2 bucks for a taco loaded with meat, crema and at least a quarter of an avocado.  The carnitas is so juicy and delicious.  With the complimentary fresh chips and a melon agua fresca, you're good to go.

I also LOVE the guacamole-esque salsa verde that comes with the chips, and their horchata is some of the best I've had (there's a little extra cardamom in there, or something).  

Mmmmm.  Salivating just thinking about it.
author: Amanda R.

description: I've been here a few times because it's convenient to a friend's house. I've had their Super burritos, Chicken and today I had Shrimp. The Shrimp Super burrito is ok, lots of shrimp but it tasted a little fishy. The chips are good, salsa and hot sauces are just eh. I still heart another taqueria.
author: Karen T.

description: Amazing vegetarian burritos...their rice is perfect and they are more than generous with their avocado portions (hard to come by). They also have really great chips, not too flimsy and lots of flavor. Definitely one of my favorite burrito spots.
author: Hannah M.

description:
Ever tried to Order Over the Phone from these IDIOTS.?!!!!!!!!!
FORGET ABOUT IT.... As they either Mess Up or Even give your orders to someone else. 

HORRIBLE.
author: Alf M.

description: Super quesadilla was amazing, but more food than I would have guessed or could finish. Oh, and the salsas they give you with your meal were pretty spicy to me. Overall, good atmosphere for a Friday afternoon and I liked the picnic style tables!
author: A P.

description: It's the perfect late night drunk meal.  Lots of food, great prices.  I would say their tacos are better than their burritos.
author: Owen J.

description:
3/5 you got here drunk...again

get a burrito. everything is pretty filling. cash only though =/

after a few bites, you'll have settled enough of your stomach to keep drinking! yay!

go next door for drunk bingo at the knockout.
author: Alvin D.

description: I go here often. They'd get 5 stars if the meat was a better cut, but otherwise very very good. I usually get the carne asada super burrito to go, but if eating there the super quesadilla is fantastic. It's grilled and chock full and gooey and absolutely delicious.
author: Chris P.

description: Is this a taqueria or salvadorian restuarant? All the food taste like salvadorian food
author: Orlando B.

description: Best Burrito and Nachos in town.  Actually, in state. Actually, in the Country. Never been disappointed, they have amazing Carne Asada, and the best Salsa Verde imaginable.  I wont say the staff is the kindest and most welcoming, but it is after all a Taqueria that sells you a 2 lb burrito for $5.  Great Tacos, Quesadillas and other items, but they specialize in their Burritos.  Just look at the wall to the right of the register, you'll see countless "San Francisco's best Burrito" certificates. Also, unless you have a gargantuan appetite, you can usually save enough of your food for a second meal.  Great Horchata too.
author: Benjamin F.

description: This is a great place for burritos!  The price is right and the burritos here are big. The only complaint I have is they only take cash. I rarely carry cash nowadays and I'll go more ofter if they start taking credit csrds.
author: May M.

description: This place has a pretty good burrito. I had the Vegetarian Burrito and it was a big burrito, very good. The chips and salsa are not good. The chips are overly salty wholesale chips and the salsa comes in little cups that' makes it obvious it's not made in house. Overall it's a good deal for this neighborhood with a burrito costing you $5.50.
author: Ryan M.

description:
This place is bangin' because it has delicious torta's for $5 that come with everything delicious(beans, sour cream, avacado, meat, tomato). Also, every order comes with chips and salsa!! This place is a really good deal, and unlike other taquerias in the area, it has a pretty descent sized dining area that is also nice looking.

you can tell this place is popular because it is crowded even at random, non-usual dining times.

Go here for a torta al pastor, you will not regret it. While you are at it, get an horchata.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
They are cheap. They are right by my apartment. They have amazing chorizo.  They are open late.  They are fast.  They are friendly.  They are delicious.  They have all the parts of the cow that I could never bring myself to eat but it's nice to know that they're there anyway.  They have great salsa.

One time they got my order wrong but what I ended up with was better than what I'd ordered anyway, so I didn't complain.
author: J S.

description:
I don't know which one I went to.
And it wasn't because I was drunk.
I honestly don't remember which one I went to. And yes, I am too lazy to google map it. And I didn't know until know that there were more than one.
Usually, we go at night. AKA I can't see the surroundings very well. Usually its good. Sometimes the salsa is too spicy for my taste, but its usually passable and quite flavorful.
I decided I wanted to go out on a limb and get the taco salad. Apparently, MAYBE, from a different Cancun than I usually frequent. 
Blek.
Whichever one it was I went to, don't go to it. Not much flavor, or color, and it just looked sad. 
BF had the burrito and he didn't finish it. That's even sadder...
author: jeddie k.

description:
I'm hooked on their Vegetarian Burritos.

$5.46 with tax & they're huge!

Great for a cheap dinner with pals & definitely more than enough burrito for two. And chips & salsa come with every order.

Yum...
author: Sara L.

description:
This location of Taqueria Cancun is my local taco stop and one of the selling points of my neighborhood. Many a late night have ended with a basket of chips and salsa and some tacos, thus bolstering my chances of avoiding a wretched hangover the following morning. 

More often than not, I stop by here to purchase a soda cup of the salsa verde. Yeah, the slightly creamy kind with the fresh avocado blended in. It's off the hook and really takes home-made huevos rancheros or what have you to the next level. I can and have made a meal out of that salsa before.
author: Candice L.

description:
I honestly don't know why people think these places are so great. I don't know how many Taqueria Cancuns there are but there are two that I know of and they are both absolutely average. If I could give it 2 1/2 stars I would, I'm rounding up instead of down because I don't want to be a dick about it. 

In an area full of Mexican places I really think you can do better.
author: Manny F.

description:
Before a visit to Naps tres for some bad karaoke, I was hankerin' for some mexican food. I was told by a local, to hit up taqueria cancun only a few steps up the street.

bleh, blah, bluh, just about sums up the experience.

I ordered a burrito with pollo asado and a taco de lengua. My first bite of  lengua tasted old and tough. Yuck. I initially wanted to try the Sesos, and now I'm glad they didn't have any. I can't even imagine what old brain tastes like. After pushing the taco to the side, I started on the Burrito. I couldn't find any meat in my burrito, until I was about half way down. Where's the meat?!?  Where's the flavor? Where's the Salsa?

I concur with Tom R. and agree that there are a lot of other places in the Mission that are way better.
author: Robin K.

description:
Out of the 3 TC locations, this one's the most welcoming. 

I've had all of their vegetarian options- all equally delicious. Seriously, you can't go wrong. 

Definitely my favorite place outside of Mexico to get a taco!
author: varuka c.

description:
Been there a bunch of times.  One time I pulled up front in my new car and I parked.  Then a group of young Mexican guys all leaned on my car or looked like they were about to, because they were drunk or just losers.  This car is black and brand new and the last thing in the world I need is some losers leaning on my car.  So I hopped back into my car and took off because it's not worth it to me.  Sure, I get a cheap taco, but the cost of the damage to the car is much more.  Paint costs a lot.

Anyways, the food is always good and cheap.  Not too long ago (a few months) there was a viscous stabbing there.  A woman stabbed a man because she didn't like what he said.  Not exactly a safe area you know?  

So tonight I went to the Lexington and afterwards i told my friend let's go to El Farolito.  She wanted to eat before driving, which is a good idea.  So we went to Cancun.  I have ate there a lot in my life...because I am poor and I love Mexican food.  The veggie torta I had tonight was delicious, but not nearly as good as El Farolito.  

Cancun always has friendly and efficient employees.  Must be a hard place to work at.  those employees deserve purple stars.  The place needs a security guard like they have at El Farolito and so many other late night restauarnats.

In a nutshell.......great prices, fast service, yummy food, dangerous area.  I am sort of torn between 4 stars and 3 stars because of the violence.  I guess it's not the fault of the establishment so I will go with 4 stars.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
My girlfriend loves this place, she'll travel across town just for one of their veggie burritos and its definitely what she misses most about the mission. 

I however didn't get the hype. Their tacos - meh. The pastor burritos - meh. The chips - barely edible. 

And then I tried one of their super veggie burritos with black beans and now I'm almost as obsessed as my girlfriend. They've got these huge chunks of perfectly ripe avocado that just melt in your mouth. Definitely one of the better burritos I've had in my life.

Go cancun!

 Oh and open one up in NOPA so I won't have to trek across town.
author: Murphy O.

description:
Like the other versions of this place, the food is affordable, tasty, and this one is open past 12am. On top of things, the food is prepared quickly, the people taking your order are friendly, and the area isn't too bad. There's not much you can ask for from a restaurant that serves Mexican food when you just ended a night on the town, or perhaps a long day at work, or doing something that gives you the munchies after 10pm at night.

This version of Taqueria Cancun is located near the end of Bernal Heights, Mission, and Glen Park. It's close to a Safeway and El Zocalo.

Overall, there's nothing bad about this place other than it's not the greatest gourmet Mexican food on earth, but it isn't the worst. Come here if you want a cheap & filling meal, but don't expect that much.
author: Rob L.

description: Fast, tasty, inexpensive Mexican food!
author: Richard A.

description:
Here is the truth: Cancun is inconsistent. However, 4 out of 7 times you will enjoy a terrific Mexican meal. 2 out of 7 you'll have a good meal and 1 out of 7 you'll forget you had a meal. Those are excellent odds.

My strategy is to call ahead - "pickup five minutes" - walk the dog over (approx five minutes), retrieve my freshly made tacos/burrito/breakfast burrito, and stroll home to feast in front of Seinfeld reruns. About as wonderful an evening as they come.

SECRET TIP: Get the Mexican coffee. It is mindblowing and nobody knows about it. I'm drinking some now, which is why I'm writing this review.
author: matt s.

description: I do not like Mission-style burritos. I thought I never would, but Taqueria Can-Cún has changed that opinion indefinitely! I got the veggie burrito with added jalapeños. Was spicy and delectable. I can only eat half so it's great because my husband and I both get a meal for around $6. Plus, you can trot on over to El Rio with your nice, warm burrito and chill out!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
HANDS DOWN. BEST TAQUERIA IN TOWN.

I WILL MISS YOU DEARLY TAQUERIA CANCUN SINCE I MOVED TO EAST BAY.

Let me just say, their super beef quesadilla or any other type of quesadilla is absolutely delicious. From the quality of the tortilla itself, to the yummy carne asada, to the pieces of whole avocado versus putting gross and watery guacamole, to the way they wrap it with aluminum foil to keep it warm and soft. Absolutely delicious and quesadilla second to none.

Super nachos are also great! 

Their hours are also extremely accommodating!! ONLY TAQUERIA IN THE CITY OPEN TILL 2:45 AM DAILY! 

LOVE IT, ADORE IT, OBSESSED!

CONS: they do not accept credit cards. This is absolutely RIDICOULOUS because it is only a way to drive clientele who does not want to pay a $3 ATM fee and other $3 NON-BANK ATM fee away... It's really a shame cuz I was often forced to hit el Toro as I only had a crdit card on me and was lt willing to use their ATM :(
