The bright yellow-ness of Taqueria Cancun drew me in and despite all the signs blaring about how their veggie burrito is #1, I was feeling the meat.   I asked the nice guy working behind the counter what he recommended:  "I like the chicken".  Can't argue with that.  I ordered a super chicken burrito.  I really liked the two salsas that came with it, especially the creamy green one.  The chips WERE stale as many other yelpers have noted.  The burrito was good.  Loved the pieces of avocado, the beans, rice, cilantro parts.  The chicken was just okay.  The flavor was good but some of the pieces were the bad rubbery/chunky parts that shouldn't have made it into the burrito (only a couple).

All in all, a pretty good burrito.  Next time I'm in the neighborhood and craving a burrito I'd go for the veggie one.
author: Raleigh S.

description: super quesadilla al pastor. I don't need to add anything else....
author: stephan c.

description: They get 4 Stars for the Chorizo Burrito. I used to live around the corner, and  they'd let me bring my dog in.  I loved everyhting they made!
author: Gary B.

description:
this is a reallly good taqueria.
i live around the block and have been eating there since 6 mos. old.
my fave items are the nachos ,the super burritos and the ceviche. 
i don't care what other persons think about this place.
i'm age 10 and i like it.

we can smell the cooking beans in the morning when the cooks start to prepare for the day.  no complaints from our street.
author: olive l.

description: After reading countless glowing reviews from the Guardian each year on this place, I finally tried it. I am now convinced that most people in SF have no clue on what constitutes good Mexican food. How many times have you heard some drunken Marinaite tell you that the restaurant has to be filthy to be good Mexican? Why? So you can get sick? This place is fairly dirty, bad score from Health Dept., but it's really the boring food. Carne asada is dull and rubbery, and the burrito are way too crammed with the overly oniony salsa. A hint to serving chips and salsa: chips from a bag are not authentic, and don't taste good. Keeping the salsa in the fridge where it absorbs all the other stale flavors is not a good idea. Skip this one. Go to La Cumbre, Pancho Villa, or El Toro. La Corneta is awesome as well, and yes my pasty-faced friends, IT'S CLEAN.
author: Michael F.

description: i love them juicy big fat burritos lol, bc that's what they are for me...everything i had eaten from here has been delicious and had made my tummy happy=]. love this place!
author: Vale O.

description:
"This is the ONLY Taqueria Cancun. Most San Franciscans only refer to the first one on "the mile" drag of Mission Street. People who think vegetarian burritos are legitimate. ;-)  In my opinion that location has always been a bit overrated, although I do enjoy their Alambres and the classic Ranchera jukebox. Nothing like Lola Beltran belting "Cuccurrucucu Paloma" or Vicente Fernandez wailing "Volver, Volver" to enhance the ambience of a casual Mexican meal. The Cancun closer to the Bernal Heights side of south Mission is vastly superior in food quality, cleanliness, and general atmosphere. Ideally flavor is the only thing that matters in a taqueria though, and I've never been disappointed by this location's goodies. You can forget about the Cancun on Market Street unless you need to drop in for convenience. Perhaps the issue is size. The less crowded the kitchen, the better the food seems to be in this chain. Let the masses go to the perfectly fine La Taqueria down the street. It has its superb tacos, but if you want a less hectic, less noisy taco/burrito experience, consider walking several blocks up Mission to the Bernal Heights Cancun. It's one of the "best kept secrets" of the area.

Yes, the chips suck. Oh well. The salsas are very good and the "entrees" are tacqueria-perfect."
author: Dean E.

description: I got a burrito al pastor here yesterday. Two hours later I had a terrible headache and felt like throwing up. Stayed that way for hours. My stomach hurt and I had a case of Montezuma's Revenge all night and this morning. I'm trying to imagine what they did to the meat that would make me so sick. Disgusting...
author: Rich D.

description: Cancun is great.  Food, space, and prices are good.  Staff could be a little friendly.
author: Customer X.

description: it's shameful that this place shares a name w/ the taqueria cancun that's in the heart of the mission.  the other taqueria cancun is one of the best taquerias in town, while this one is... well... really crappy.  it just doesnt compare.  do yourself a favor and drive the 15 blocks to the other one.
author: vlad k.

description: of all the cancun's. this location is my favorite. its generally the least crowded and hectic and it still comes with the great cancun food. the burritos are pretty hefty and ive never left this place unsatisfied.
author: Andrew D.

description: This place is alright, it has a great decor (gotta love how they pump that Mexican music all night), however the extraordinary really ends there.  The food is truly mediocre when compared to many other taqs in San Francisco.  I will concede that the prices are a little lower than many other Mexican joints, but the food is reduced in quality (by just a little).  Cancun boasts that they have the best vegetarian burrito in the city.  This I will unequivocally refute: While the veggie is well-priced, it is substantially smaller than other burritos around town, and is mostly tortilla wrapped around itself a bunch of times.  It tastes just OK, but Castillito's (in the Loin) veggie is much larger and more delicious.  This place has a lot of hype surrounding it, I guess it is due to its location near a lot of bars.  Drunk people can't tell their ass from their elbow, let alone discern truly quality Taqueria food.  All that being said, Cancun is a fine place to get a quick dinner, but just fine.
author: Mr. G.

description: i don't know how many taquerias i have eaten at in SF.  super carne asada burritos are my thing.  back in the day, Cancun was winning best of the bay so one evening i reluctantly passed up a burrito at el farolito to try it.  i wasn't happy and didn't go back.  years later when i moved to 94110, my wife convinced me to give it another go.  still didn't work for me.  people love, it but for burritos i prefer other places.
author: jw b.

description: I prefer this to the other location because it doesn't feel as cramped. My friend ordered one of the dinner plates, and while I only took a few bites from it, it looked really hearty and worth ordering. My top recommendation here is the ceviche. Unlike at El Farolito, Cancun's ceviche isn't weirdly juicy. It's spiced just right and perfectly crunchy.
author: Joseph R.

description: I don't like the chairs and decor at this one nearly as much as the one just a few blocks away.  The food is still delicious.
author: B B.

description: since brisas was closed, the next best source of carne asada that the sweetie was having a hankering for was found at Taqueria Cancun. it's true, it's not the same as the one in lower Mission BUT i was happy to find a late-night place where i can get food served promptly and the peeps were super nice. the burrito mojado was scrumptious though the meat was a tad dry. the sauce was mole-esque and not in a bad way.
author: ray e.

description: at 2pm or 2am their food is pretty good.  a little too spicy for my white girl taste so, if you're like me ask for everything to be mild. and i mean EVERYTHING. the tacos, burritos and nachos are all hella spicy.  and no, i did not eat all of these in one sitting.  extra star for the fabulous beer selection.
author: Ms. M.

description: Love the Chicken taco salad, chicken nachos and burritos. The inside is very cute and lively and the employees are all really friendly. Very inexpensive compared to a lot of places. Very clean too.
author: r e.

description: everyone has their favorite cancun.  well this one is mine.  not sure why but it just is.  that green salsa kills me but i love it.  i try to get the chorizo and eggs whenever i come here.  the burritos are decent.
author: a g.

description: if you want to try the amazingness that are cancun burritos go to this one, not the one at 19th and mission. this one is relaxed, cleaner and doesn't have bums. plus you can sit at your own table. always quick, always delicious. easily my favorite burrito in the city.
author: Dan C.

description: cancun would be mediocre, except that they have legendary al pastor. the horchata is also pretty good.
author: Katherine S.

description: quick run before you get the runs......i broke out in a cold sweat and now i have a permanent eye twitch....stay away
author: Roger T.
